title: Ticket #1437: Make submit file option for equivalent of -disable
description:
condor_submit has an option called -disable, which disables checks for files. There is is an equivalent option in the configuration file called SUBMIT_SKIP_FILECHECKS.

I think that the submit file should have an option for this. That is, you should be able to put something like:

skip_filechecks = True

in the submit file. There are two reasons for this:

1) When you need a DAG where some jobs need to disable file checks, there is no easy way to pass "-disable" via condor_submit_dag or the DAG description file.

2) The configuration option SUBMIT_SKIP_FILECHECKS applies to all jobs. If you argue that it can be set in the environment per-job, I would argue that's both ugly, and it's hard to make it apply to some jobs in a DAG but not others.

There is someone at Argonne's APS that wants this feature (Claude Saunders), so there is a real customer. For the moment he can use workarounds, but they're much uglier.

Thanks!
